body:
数据集完整吗？我不太理解你说的意思，你是说标注信息之类的完整性？

> 在 2019年4月14日，下午8:59，IdleCell. <notifications@github.com> 写道：
> 
> 你的数据集完整吗？
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

> 你的数据集完整吗？

完整的啊

Comment the #index += 1 in __getitem__ and change 
def __len__(self):
        return self.nSamples + 1
To
def __len__(self):
        return self.nSamples

That fixed my issue.

> Comment the #index += 1 in **getitem** and change
> def **len**(self):
> return self.nSamples + 1
> To
> def **len**(self):
> return self.nSamples
> 
> That fixed my issue.

In my program，this method can't solve my problem.Thank you all the same!

You can make your program print which image is giving the Nonetype problem. And it'll print the your (nSample_size + 1) image which doesn't exist. 

It may not help but I'm giving suggestions ^-^

And you're welcome.
请问下楼主解决这个问题了么？我也遇到了同样的问题

> 请问下楼主解决这个问题了么？我也遇到了同样的问题
没有，试了楼上的方法，没有用，期待作者有什么方法解决。
我似乎解决了 打印index发现 生成的txt文件里最后两张图片的路径有问题，将生成的txt最后两行删掉在我这里就不会报错了

> 我似乎解决了 打印index发现 生成的txt文件里最后两张图片的路径有问题，将生成的txt最后两行删掉在我这里就不会报错了

你是说你用那个data_generator来做的数据，在生成label的时候图片路径有错误？

I'm the same @mariembs01 ^^
Based on @shengyucaihua experience,
Here for those using data_generator:
def __len__(self):
        return self.nSamples - 1 #<--- change this like this

    def __getitem__(self, index):
        assert index < len(self), 'index range error' # <--- instead of <= change it to <
        
        with self.env.begin(write=False) as txn:
            img_key = 'image-%09d' % index
            imgbuf = txn.get(img_key.encode('utf-8'))

            buf = six.BytesIO()
            buf.write(imgbuf)
            buf.seek(0)
            try:
                img = Image.open(buf).convert('L')
            except IOError:
                print('Corrupted image for %d' % index)
                return self[index + 1]

            if self.transform is not None:
                img = self.transform(img)

            label_key = 'label-%09d' % index
            label = txn.get(label_key.encode())

            if self.target_transform is not None:
                label = self.target_transform(label)
        index += 1 # <-- put the index += 1 here
        return (img, label)

This won't print the last two empty cases that produces the Nonetype error

> I'm the same @mariembs01 ^^
> Based on @shengyucaihua experience,
> Here for those using data_generator:
> def **len**(self):
> return self.nSamples - 1 #<--- change this like this
> 
> ```
> def __getitem__(self, index):
>     assert index < len(self), 'index range error' # <--- instead of <= change it to <
>     
>     with self.env.begin(write=False) as txn:
>         img_key = 'image-%09d' % index
>         imgbuf = txn.get(img_key.encode('utf-8'))
> 
>         buf = six.BytesIO()
>         buf.write(imgbuf)
>         buf.seek(0)
>         try:
>             img = Image.open(buf).convert('L')
>         except IOError:
>             print('Corrupted image for %d' % index)
>             return self[index + 1]
> 
>         if self.transform is not None:
>             img = self.transform(img)
> 
>         label_key = 'label-%09d' % index
>         label = txn.get(label_key.encode())
> 
>         if self.target_transform is not None:
>             label = self.target_transform(label)
>     index += 1 # <-- put the index += 1 here
>     return (img, label)
> ```
> This won't print the last two empty cases that produces the Nonetype error

I try this but get the same wrong,do you deal with it?

> Comment the #index += 1 in **getitem** and change
> def **len**(self):
> return self.nSamples + 1
> To
> def **len**(self):
> return self.nSamples
> 
> That fixed my issue.

This method fixed my issue, too! Thank you very much!
